column4: I'm Someoneis. I'm back and I don't have enough disc space to back stuff up on another partition.
then what if the drive motor dies and the data is irretrievable. where is your data?
I can access the data with the live CD. Is there any way I can transfer it to my other computer?
no backup == data is disposable and unimportant
sure you can mount the partition(s) under the livecd and use nautilus to access the shares on another system
How can I do such a thing?
you will need to share a folder on another system to spit the file to
it willhave an entry under places
May you lead me in the right direction for sharing files between ubuntu and windows?
windows can share folders already, setting that up is as simple as rihtclicking a folder, you can then (in nautilus) type:    smb://wndowshostname/sharename
I know how to do it on windows but I don't know how to do it on ubuntu.
you dont have to in ubuntu, you can simply access the share as I said above
Is it set up automatically for the LAN network?
if the nic is detected it will auto use dhcp by default
I didn't think it would be that simple, I will give it a go and let you know how it goes.
its as easy as windows. why did you think it would be hard?
Things I have done in the past for ubuntu wasn't as easy. But then again, I'm just novice for ubuntu.
probably due to microsoft over use, ubuntu is slightly different but can work just as easily with use
